meanings.definition: The quality or state of being self-existent or self-sufficient.
meanings.sent1: Her seity allowed her to thrive independently.
meanings.sent2: The seity of the ancient tree was evident in its ability to grow without external help.
meanings.sent3: The cat's seity was on full display as it caught a mouse all by itself.
meanings.sent4: The seity of the mountain stood tall and proud, untouched by human hands.
meanings.sent5: The seity of the lone wolf symbolized freedom and strength in the wild.

meanings.definition: The essential nature or essence of a thing.
meanings.sent1: The seity of the flower was its vibrant color and delicate petals.
meanings.sent2: In art class, we learned to capture the seity of objects through still life drawings.
meanings.sent3: The seity of the joke was lost in translation, leaving everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent4: His music captured the seity of human emotions, resonating with listeners worldwide.
meanings.sent5: The seity of the old book was its timeless wisdom and captivating stories.
